# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `cd_all`
* Variable label: `History of Cardiac disorders`
* Variable description: `The participant has been diagnosed by one or more of the following conditions: angina, myocardial infarction, heart attack, coronary heart disease, congestive heart failure, heart murmur, valve disease`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | No, the participant has not been diagnosed of any of these conditions
1        | Yes, the participant has been diagnosed by any of these conditions

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing



<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of Cardiac disorders"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## Mexico


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `mi_ha`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Myocardial infarction or heart attack`|
| **Table name**  |`mi_ha`|
| **Categories** | `0 = No`<br/>`1 = Yes` |
| **Missings** | `995 = Does not answer`<br/>`998 = Do not know`<br/>`999 = Missing` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

load(paste0(datafolder,"w1/mi_ha.RData"))
MHAS_w1 <- tibble(id=mi_ha$id)
MHAS_w1$mi_ha <- mi_ha$mi_ha
rm(mi_ha)

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- MHAS_w1$mi_ha
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = names(MHAS_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(MHAS_w1, aes(x=factor(mi_ha))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `cd_all` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `just copy`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
MHAS_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=MHAS_w1$id)
MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all <- MHAS_w1$mi_ha

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(MHAS_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(cd_all))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all)
BeforeH <- table(MHAS_w1$mi_ha, useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
kable(C)

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}
MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all <- labelled(MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all, labels = cat_label)
label(MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all) <- ds_label
MHAS_ds_w2$cd_all <- labelled(MHAS_ds_w2$cd_all, labels = cat_label)
label(MHAS_ds_w2$cd_all) <- ds_label
MHAS_ds_w3$cd_all <- labelled(MHAS_ds_w3$cd_all, labels = cat_label)
label(MHAS_ds_w3$cd_all) <- ds_label


MHAS_m_ds_w1 <- MHAS_ds_w1
MHAS_m_ds_w1$cd_all <- car::recode(MHAS_m_ds_w1$cd_all, "miss_values_vector=NA")
MHAS_m_ds_w2 <- MHAS_ds_w2
MHAS_m_ds_w2$cd_all <- car::recode(MHAS_m_ds_w2$cd_all, "miss_values_vector=NA")
MHAS_m_ds_w3 <- MHAS_ds_w3
MHAS_m_ds_w3$cd_all <- car::recode(MHAS_m_ds_w3$cd_all, "miss_values_vector=NA")


tt <-    frq(MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all)[[1]][,c(1:2,4)]
tt[4] <- frq(MHAS_ds_w2$cd_all)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[5] <- frq(MHAS_ds_w3$cd_all)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(MHAS_ds_w1$cd_all), length(MHAS_ds_w2$cd_all), length(MHAS_ds_w3$cd_all)
             )
names(tt)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3")
kable(tt)

dbb <- merge(MHAS_m_ds_w1[,c("id","cd_all")], MHAS_m_ds_w2[,c("id","cd_all")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, MHAS_m_ds_w3[,c("id","cd_all")], by="id", all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2", "w3")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],dbb[,4],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```

<!-- # Save -->
```{r save, include=FALSE, echo=F}

l.MHAS <- list(w1 = MHAS_ds_w1, w2 = MHAS_ds_w2, w3 = MHAS_ds_w3)

for(index in seq_along(l.MHAS)){
  cd_all <- l.MHAS[[index]]
  save(cd_all, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.MHAS)[index],"/cd_all.RData"))
}

```
